derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English crammian, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch krammen 'to cramp or clamp'

entry.def: If you cram things or people into a container or place, you put them into it, although there is hardly enough room for them.

example.ex: While nobody was looking, she squashed her school hat and crammed it into a wastebasket...
example.tran: 趁没人看见，她把校帽弄扁塞进了废纸篓。

example.ex: I crammed my bag full of swimsuits and T-shirts and caught the sleeper down to Beziers...
example.tran: 我把泳衣和T恤衫塞进包里，乘卧铺前往贝济耶。

entry.def: If people cram into a place or vehicle or cram a place or vehicle, so many of them enter it at one time that it is completely full.

example.ex: We crammed into my car and set off...
example.tran: 我们挤进我的车子，然后出发了。

example.ex: Friends and admirers crammed the chapel at the small Los Angeles cemetery where Monroe is buried.
example.tran: 朋友和仰慕者们挤进安葬梦露的洛杉矶小公墓的教堂里。

entry.def: If you cram a hat on, you put it on, especially in a hurry.

example.ex: I crammed on my cap again, helped the Duke up and tried to dust him off.
example.tran: 我重新戴上帽子，扶公爵起身并掸去他身上的土。

entry.tran: (为应考)临时死记硬背，填鸭式学习
entry.def: If you are cramming for an examination, you are learning as much as possible in a short time just before you take the examination.

example.ex: She was cramming for her Economics exam...
example.tran: 她正在为应付经济学考试临阵磨枪。

means.word_mean: 2. put something somewhere so that the space is completely filled;
3. study intensively, as before an exam;

sentences.sentence: "I had to bone up on my Latin verbs before the final exam"

means.word_mean: 4. prepare (students) hastily for an impending exam

sentences.en: Children were crammed into the back of the car.
sentences.cn: 孩子们被塞进了车子的后座。

sentences.en: The box was crammed with letters.
She's cramming for her history exam.
sentences.cn: 她考历史之前临时抱佛脚。

jushi.english: He's been cramming for his exams all week.
jushi.chinese: 他整个星期都一直在拼命准备应考。

jushi.english: The bus is full; you cannot cram any more people into it.
jushi.chinese: 公共汽车已经满了，挤不进更多的人了。

jushi.english: Thirty of us were crammed into a small dark room.
jushi.chinese: 我们30个人被塞进一间小黑屋。
